intro: Pterospermum borneense, commonly known as the Bornean pterospermum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The seeds are encased in a hard, woody capsule, which is a distinctive feature of the genus Pterospermum.
